title: Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw and Smriti Irani First Global Address Post Elections at India Global Forum IGF London 2024
body_text:
· India Global Forum’s Blockbuster 6th Annual IGF London to Kick-Off on Monday
· Week-long IGF London commences with IGF Forum on 24 June
· Ashwini Vaishnaw, India’s newly sworn-in Minister for Railways, Information & Broadcasting, Electronics & IT to make first global address since national elections
· Former Minister of Women and Child Development Smriti Irani to highlight women’s empowerment initiatives under Modi Government
· Event on the eve of crucial national elections in the United Kingdom
· Senior Leaders of Conservative and Labour Parties to address inaugural session
London, 21 June 2024 — India Global Forum's keenly awaited ‘IGF London 2024 – Pathways to a Limitless Future' is set to kick-off in London on Monday, 24 June at the Queen Elizabeth II Centre. The 6th edition of the signature week-long event comes at a pivotal time, immediately following the results of the Indian Parliamentary election results and right ahead of the UK's general elections on July 4.
IGF Forum, the inaugural session of IGF London 2024, will delve into the results of the recent Parliamentary elections in India and its implications for both global geopolitics and businesses.
India’s newly sworn-in Minister for Railways, Information & Broadcasting, Electronics & IT, Ashwini Vaishnaw, will make his first global virtual address since the national elections, and outline the Modi 3.0 Government’s immediate priorities, as well as how global partners can participate in the Viksit Bharat initiative, India’s ambitious goal of becoming a developed nation by 2047.
In a session titled ‘It’s a Woman’s India,’ Former Minister of Women and Child Development Smriti Irani will be sharing her insights on the evolving role of women in India's socio-economic landscape and highlighting the Government’s initiatives aimed at empowering women.
To explore how businesses can best invest in and benefit from India’s growth story, industry leaders, including Kiran Mazumdar Shaw, Executive Chairperson, Biocon, and Rain Newton-Smith, CEO, Confederation of Business Industry, Sanjeev Sanyal, Member – Prime Minister’s Economic Advisory Council, among others, will provide their perspectives.
Ahead of the UK elections, IGF Forum will also raise and address many pressing questions concerning the incoming UK government, including the implications of the Free Trade Agreement (FTA) and the 2030 Roadmap for UK-India relations. In a nonpartisan demonstration of the significance of the strategic partnership with India, IGF London is an important pitstop on the campaign trail for both, the Conservative and Labour Parties.
A year after Labour Party Leader Sir Keir Starmer outlined his vision to reset his party’s strained ties with India at IGF Forum, Shadow Foreign Secretary David Lammy will be addressing the gathering, providing his perspectives on the future of strategic partnership between UK and India and the broader geopolitical landscape. Lord Tariq Ahmad, Minister of State for the Middle East, North Africa and South Asia will also be addressing the session.
Looking forward to the event, Manoj Ladwa, Founder and Chairman, India Global Forum (IGF), said: “As we gather against the backdrop of democratic milestones in the world’s oldest and largest democracies, we have a unique opportunity to turn uncertainty and the headwinds of change into opportunities. As we enter a new era in UK-India relations, we need new ideas—not just for these two nations, but for global partners. This week, IGF London will be a catalyst for ideas, collaborations, and conversations, driving innovation, economic growth, and social progress worldwide. Leveraging this bilateral relationship's unique shared values and strengths, we aim to tackle global challenges and create a collaborative platform for a brighter future. Together, we can build pathways to a limitless future.”
IGF Forum will witness a series of high-profile speakers from across the political and diplomatic spectrum, business leaders, and policy experts. The inaugural day will also feature a big announcement by best-selling authors Jeffery Archer and Amish Tripathi.
Key speakers during the event from 24-28 June include:
· Vikram Doraiswami, Indian High Commissioner to the UK
· Dr Vijay Chauthaiwale, In-Charge, Foreign Affairs Department, Bharatita Janata Party
· Lavanya Chandrashekar, CFO, Diageo
· Nicola Hodson, CEO, IBM UK & Ireland
· Kate Hampton, CEO, CIFF
· Julia Hoggett, CEO, London Stock Exchange Group
· Amit Kalyani, Vice Chair and Joint Manging Director, Bharat Forge
· Rahul Munjal, Chairman and Managing Director, Hero Future Energies
· Faizal Kottikollon, Chairman, KEF Holdings
· Sima Ved, Founder and Chairwoman, Apparel Group
· Sol Campbell, Former England and Arsenal football legend
· Chris Jones, Director, Technology and Analysis, FCDO
· Dame Wendy Hall, Member of United Nations High-level Advisory Body on AI, Regius Professor of Computer Science, University of Southampton
· Abhinav Bindra, 2008 Olympic gold medallist
· Dr Deepa Malik, Former President Indian Paralympic Committee
· Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Actor
· Aditi Rao Hydari, Actor
With over 1000 speakers and participants, and 15 events across iconic venues in London and Windsor, IGF London 2024 encompasses a spectrum of topics—from technology and trade to culture and commerce - showcasing the role of India, the UK and their global partners in tackling key challenges and unveiling new pathways to a limitless future, underpinned by innovation and collaboration. These include:
· The IGF Forum at Westminster’s QEII Centre (Monday 24 June)
· Climate & Business Forum in Central London (Tuesday 25 June)
· Global Investors Forum at the London Stock Exchange (Tuesday 25 June)
· IGF Studio and Dialogues at St James’ Court, A Taj Hotel (Wednesday 26 June)
· Culture & Creativity Forum at Fairmont Windsor Park (Thursday 27 June)
· 6th UK-India Awards at the Fairmont Windsor Park (Thursday 27 June)
· Founders & Funders Forum at the Fairmont Windsor Park (Friday 28 June)
IGF London 2024 is supported by the UK Government and India’s Ministry of External Affairs, with Corporate Partners Bloomberg, Bharat Forge, Hero Future Energies, BT group, London Stock Exchange, Roland Berger, Tulah, TV Partner ET NOW, Culture Partner Brut India, Digital Media Partners Dailyhunt and Magster.
